content.desc: The queen of tennis has told the Duchess of Sussex to ditch the congeniality. Serena Williams said Thursday that her longtime pal, the former Meghan Markle, remains as sweet as ever ― and maybe that should change as she juggles pregnancy and a reportedly tense royal life. “I’m like, ‘How are you?’ and she’s like, ‘No, how are you?’ and I’m like, ‘You’re so sweet, but I’m really asking ― how are YOU?’” Williams told People at an Art Basel event for her clothing line in Miami. “I’m like, ‘Meghan, stop being so nice … you’re the pregnant one, aren’t you supposed to have hormones, why are you s...

content.desc: A little boy was so overwhelmed when meeting the Queen that he dropped to his knees and crawled out of the nearest door. Nine-year-old Nathan Grant was so starstruck upon being introduced to the monarch by his adoptive parents, former Fame Academy judges David and Carrie Grant, that he bolted out of the room, shouting "bye" as he left. Onlookers can be seen laughing in a video captured during the exchange while the Queen visited Coram, the UK's oldest children's charity. Based at the site of The Foundling Hospital in London, Coram has been helping vulnerable children since it gained the Roy...

content.desc: An exterior view of The Milestone Hotel in London The Milestone Hotel in Kensington has character. And it’s beloved: it’s long been rated number three out of over 1,000 hotels in London. Three Kensington townhouses combined to make one 57-room hotels, from the outside this 1920s building is discreet and unassuming compared to the elaborate interiors revealed once inside. One of 17 hotels in a Red Carnation group, a boutique portfolio of hotels run by Brett Tollman and his wife Bea – they also have property’s in Ireland, South Africa, Switzerland and the United States. Brimming with old-scho...

content.desc: The Duchess of Sussex has continued to encourage open conversations about gender equality by discussing the subject while making a surprise visit at a London university. On Wednesday 5 December, the duchess ventured to King’s College London for an event held by the Association of Commonwealth Universities (ACU). A caption reads: “See ya later, race traitor!” Meghan Markel became the first mixed-race woman to join the modern British royal family after she married Harry earlier this year. According to a BBC investigation, the neo-Nazi group identifies itself as the Sonnenkrieg Division, a British offshoot of...

content.desc: Ever since the Duchess of Cambridge stepped up to her Royal duties in 2011 she has flown the flag for lavish hair accessories. From bold hats during state services to traditional ornate fascinators at society weddings, she has always taken a regal approach to Royal dressing and accessories. However since returning from maternity leave this autumn, the Duchess has modernised her once quite formal approach to hair accessories and has brought back traditional styles like the headband and pretty grosgrain ribbons in an elegant, modern way. content.desc: Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, is pregnant with her first child, the UK's royal family has announced. A statement from Kensington Palace said the baby is expected in the spring of 2019. Britain's Queen Elizabeth II will be the child's great-grandmother. The Queen and other members of the royal family congratulated Meghan and her husband, Prince Harry, on Friday as they gathered in Windsor for Princess Eugenie's wedding to Jack Brooksbank, a royal source said Monday, without specifying whether the parents-to-be broke the news at their cousin's wedding. content.desc: Comedian Amy Schumer lightheartedly dubbed Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex, her “nemesis” while offering up life tips in a new video. “Why is she my nemesis? Now, howeve...

content.title: ミハエル・オバマのメガガン・マークルの甘いアドバイスはシンプルで完璧です -  HuffPost
content.desc: Michelle Obama has faced her fair share of criticism and praise after many, many years in the public eye. Naturally, this makes the former first lady the right person to share some sound ― and sweet ― advice for Meghan Markle as the Duchess of Sussex deals with a whole new global level of fame. “Like me, Meghan probably never dreamt that she’d have a life like this,” Obama said in a new interview for Good Housekeeping’s January issue. “The pressure you feel ― from yourself and from others ― can sometimes feel like a lot,” she said. “So my biggest piece of advice would be to take some time a...

content.desc: Having spent eight years living in the White House as half of one of the most powerful duos on the planet, no one is better equipped than Michelle Obama at knowing how to maintain a happy relationship in the public eye. Seven months since she became an official member of the royal family, the Duchess of Sussex has seemingly adapted very well to the role, having recently taken on her first solo project with the release of the Together cookbook. However, being a part of one of the most famous marriages in the world can take its toll, which is why Michelle has shared the advice that she would ...

The Daily Beast suggested this weekend that “appearing together on Christmas Day will be a useful way for the Sussexes an...

content.title: MeghanとKateの間の偽の争いは、報道陣の偏見を明らかにする -  The Guardian
content.desc: Clothing is often the only prism through which many publications are able to discuss high-profile women – something Amal Clooney, Michelle Obama and Hillary Clinton know too well. So, when Meghan Markle’s engagement to Prince Harry was announced last year, the media welcomed her into the royal family with an onslaught of articles pitting her outfits against the Duchess of Cambridge’s in a fabricated war of “Who wore it best?” It didn’t matter that they were almost never wearing the same thing – more often than not, they were decked out in different coats or fascinators in a vaguely similar ...

content.title: Priyanka Chopraはラージャスターンで壮大な3日間の結婚式でニックジョナスと結婚する -  The Telegraph
content.desc: With a barrage of spectacular fireworks lighting up the night sky over Jodhpur, Priyanka Chopra - a close friend of the Duchess of Sussex - married her fiance Nick Jonas on Saturday. The Indian-born actress, 36, and the 26-year-old American musician tied the knot at the Umaid Bhawan Palace in Rajasthan, just four months after their engagement. Jonas’s father, Paul Kevin Jonas Sr, a Christian pastor, conducted the ceremony, a culmination of three days of celebrations. The couples guests, who had begun arriving at the palace on Thursday afternoon, were presented with special personalized silv...

content.desc: It is surprisingly prescient advice given the slew of recent allegations made about the Duchess of Sussex’s forthright demeanor and demands. content.desc: Chris Jackson/GETTY It’s another day of challenging headlines for Meghan Markle this weekend, as two separate reports claim firstly that she asked if air fresheners could be sprayed in the 550-year old chapel in which she was married to Prince Harry in May, and secondly that her relationship with Kate hit the skids after she was slapped down by Kate after she chastised a member of Kate’s staff in the run-up to her weddign to Prince Harry. content.title: ミシェル・オバマは、メセナ、サセックス公爵夫人、CNN
content.desc: Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, has had plenty of guidance from palace staff on how to be a royal. But her latest piece of advice comes from someone closer to home -- former first lady Michelle Obama. "Like me, Meghan probably never dreamt that she'd have a life like this, and the pressure you feel -- from yourself and from others -- can sometimes feel like a lot," Obama told the British magazine Good Housekeeping, according to interview excerpts published Monday. "So my biggest piece of advice would be to take some time and don't be in a hurry to do anything. I spent the first few months in...

content.title: このクリスマス、ハリーとメガンとケイトとウィリアムはニースを作る必要があります - 毎日の獣
content.desc: Photo Illustration by Elizabeth Brockway/The Daily Beast Feud or not, it seems likely that the next time the British people will see Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton together in public will be on Christmas Day at Sandringham, on their way in and out of church with the Queen. The Christmas Day picture, as well as being a gift to news organizations on an otherwise dead news day, has always been a kind of stop motion paen to that most royal of virtues; incremental change. The frosty grass in the background, the loyal serfs clustered around the ancient stone building, and, most importantly of a...
